title: Baidu will report earnings after the market close
text:
CNBC.com ChinaFotoPress | ChinaFotoPress | Getty Images 
Chinese search engine Baidu is expected to report fourth quarter and full-year earnings and revenue after the bell on Tuesday. 
Here's what Wall Street projects: EPS: $2.12 (13.31 CNY) , according to Thomson Reuters Revenue: $ 3.67 billion (23.05 billion CNY), according to Thomson Reuters 
Baidu earnings have surpassed analyst expectations throughout all of fiscal 2017, and analysts polled by Thomson Reuters expect year-over-year revenue growth of 26 percent. The company's growth has been driven by efforts to advance artificial intelligence (AI) development and mobile search optimization. 
Last quarter, the company spun off its Baidu Deliveries and mobile games businesses to focus more resources on AI and a variety of other projects. In that same quarter, Baidu beat expectations on earnings by a wide margin, but just missed analyst consensus on revenue. 
Even as it trimmed deliveries and mobile games, Baidu pushed further into projects executives hope will help level the playing field with competitors Alibaba and Tencent. 
Baidu has also thrown its hat into the autonomous vehicle game, striking up relationships with Ford, ON Semiconductor and, most recently, BlackBerry to develop self-driving technology. 
Baidu even announced plans in October to release a fully autonomous bus in China in 2018. 
As of Monday's close, Baidu shares were up 20.46 percent year over year. Chloe Aiello News Associate for CNBC.com Related Securities
